movies.title: The Rivals
movies.plot: A pair of hoodlums steal a car in which there is a note - a ransom letter - directed to a wealthy man whose daughter has just been kidnapped. The two gangsters stole the abductor's car and when they find the note, they decide to take advantage of the situation and collect the money.
movies.simplePlot: A pair of hoodlums steal a car in which there is a note - a ransom letter - directed to a wealthy man whose daughter has just been kidnapped. The two gangsters stole the abductor's car and ...

biography.bio: Although he did not turn to the stage until middle age after two decades in the Royal Navy, Jack Gwillim was a notable actor on both sides of the Atlantic. During the 1950s he was a member of the Royal Shakespeare company in Stratford, England, for three years during Sir Anthony Quayle's stint as artistic director, and a member of the Old Vic Company for a further three years. His extensive theatre credits included many leading roles in the West End including "Sacred Flame" with Gladys Cooper and Wendy Hiller, "The Right Honourable Gentleman" with Quayle, "The Dark is Light Enough" with Dame Edith Evans, "Castle In Sweden" with Diane Cilento, "Portrait Of Murder", "A Kind Of Folly" with Dame Flora Robson, "You Never Can Tell" and "Merchant Of Venice" with Sir Ralph Richardson. In 1969 he emigrated to the United States, working in top regional theaters, off-Broadway and Broadway. His Broadway credits include the role of Col. Pickering in Rex Harrison revival of "My Fair Lady", and Ingrid Bergman's husband in "The Constant Wife" directed by Sir John Gielgud. Other Broadway shows included "Ari", "MacBeth" with Christopher Plummer and 'Glenda Jackson (I)', "Romeo and Juliet", "Lost in the Stars" with Brock Peters, "The Iceman Cometh" with James Earl Jones and with the Old Vic "MacBeth", "Romeo and Juliet" with Claire Bloom, "Richard II" and "Troilus and Cressida." He did numerous tours in the U.S including "Laurette" with Judy Holliday. On stage he has worked with such actors as Sir Ralph Richardson, Sir Anthony Quayle, Dame Judith Anderson, Judi Dench, Sir Michael Redgrave and Richard Burton. He is also known for war films such as Pursuit of the Graf Spee (1956) with Peter Finch, The One That Got Away (1957), North West Frontier (1959) with Lauren Bacall and Sink the Bismarck! (1960). His work in epics includes Solomon and Sheba (1959) with Yul Brynner, Cromwell (1970) with Richard Harris, Oscar-winning films Lawrence of Arabia (1962), Patton (1970) and A Man for All Seasons (1966). His work in cult favorites includes Jason and the Argonauts (1963) and Clash of the Titans (1981) with Sir Laurence Olivier. His work in "Hammer" films includes Sword of Sherwood Forest (1960) with Peter Cushing, Circus of Horrors (1960) and The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb (1964). He also co-starred in the Disney hit In Search of the Castaways (1962) with Maurice Chevalier and Hayley Mills. His voice work can be heard on Caedmon Records in "Anthony & Cleopatra", "King John", "Macbeth", "Richard II", "Titus Andronicus", "Troilus and Cressida", "Hamlet", "A Midsummer Night's Dream", and "Henry IV" parts I and II and "Henry V".
biography.name: Jack Gwillim

biography.bio: Blonde Erica Rogers was born in Cape Town, South Africa, in the late 1930s and, after local theatrical work, came to London to study at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts before opening on the West End stage in "The World of Suzie Wong". Throughout the 1960s, she was a frequent guest star on British television series, particularly The Saint (1962) but returned to South Africa in the 1970s to make numerous stage appearances, including as Margaret Thatcher in the comedy play "Anyone For Dennis?". In 1991, she moved to Los Angeles. She has two children and makes very infrequent character appearances in films.
biography.name: Erica Rogers

biography.bio: Brian Smith was born on December 24, 1932 in Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, England. He is an actor, known for The Browning Version (1951), The Rivals (1963) and Battle Hell (1957).
biography.name: Brian Smith

biography.bio: Tony Garnett was born on April 3, 1936 in Birmingham, West Midlands, England. He is a producer and actor, known for Beautiful Thing (1996), Kes (1969) and Earth Girls Are Easy (1988).
biography.name: Tony Garnett

biography.bio: Barry Linehan was born on September 23, 1925 in Ireland. He was an actor, known for Witchcraft (1964), Suburban Wives (1972) and The Rivals (1963). He died on June 8, 1996 in England.
biography.name: Barry Linehan

biography.bio: Murray Hayne was born in 1931 in India. He is an actor, known for The Rivals (1963), The Brothers (1972) and Death Trap (1962). He has been married to Gillian Muir since 1958. They have four children.
biography.name: Murray Hayne

biography.bio: Howard Greene was born on November 21, 1923 in Bargoed, Monmouthshire, Wales as Henry Howard Greenhouse. He was an actor, known for A Shot in the Dark (1964), Horrors of the Black Museum (1959) and Mystery in the Mine (1959). He was married to Marjie Lawrence. He died on March 4, 2013 in London, England.
biography.name: Howard Greene

biography.bio: Philip Latham was born on January 17, 1929 in Essex, England as Charles Philip Latham. He is an actor, known for The Cedar Tree (1976), The Pallisers (1974) and Force 10 from Navarone (1978). He has been married to Eve Latham since September 12, 1960. They have two children.
biography.name: Philip Latham

biography.bio: Maria Lennard is an actress, known for Munster, Go Home! (1966), Billie (1965) and The Rivals (1963).
biography.name: Maria Lennard

biography.bio: Jack Rodney was born in 1916. He was an actor, known for Time Slip (1953), Concrete Jungle (1960) and A Comedy of Good and Evil (1948). He died on February 20, 1967 in London, England.
biography.name: Jack Rodney

biography.bio: Donna Pearson is an actress, known for The Rivals (1963), The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960) and The Larkins (1958).
biography.name: Donna Pearson

biography.bio: Anthony Bailey was born on October 30, 1931 in Hammersmith, London, England as Anthony Albert Gerard Bailey. He was an actor, known for The Deadly Bees (1966), Sex and the Other Woman (1972) and Captain Nemo and the Underwater City (1969). He died on May 29, 2004 in Croydon, Surrey, England.
biography.name: Anthony Bailey

biography.bio: Michael Mellinger was born on May 30, 1929 in Kochel, Bavaria. He was an actor, known for Gladiator (2000), Goldfinger (1964) and Dirty Pretty Things (2002). He died on March 17, 2004 in London, England.
biography.name: Michael Mellinger

biography.bio: Ann Bassett is an actress, known for The Rivals (1963), Dixon of Dock Green (1955) and The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960).
biography.name: Ann Bassett

biography.bio: Peter Thomas was born on January 23, 1936 in England. He was an actor, known for The Conqueror Worm (1968), Sense of Enlightenment (2012) and Tales from the Crypt (1972). He died on January 5, 2017 in England.
biography.name: Peter Thomas
